column4: gftp supposedly supports SSL (TLS1) encryption on both command and data
any idea why when 'ls' the ftp server hangs?  it's windows ftp server
win2k3 server, filezilla works if in passive mode with tls enabled
filezille being an open source win32 ftp client
it's some crappy ftp server for windows i'm thinking, filezilla in win32 works fine
i'm getting `ls' at 0 [Making data connection...]  with lftp...
so he needs to open ports for ftp-data?
yes, locally it worked with filezilla ftp client in windows
i forget what the ftpd is, sure-ftpd or something?
ok then, i think ftp-data needs to be open as well as the ftpd port
i don't really care about accessing it, just helped him set it up and don't have a windows box handy to test filezilla with
looking at things, it looks like he needs to open ftp-data port, is this a security hazard?
